meanings.sent1: The soil was nitrogenous, making it perfect for growing plants.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nitrogenous compounds in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The nitrogenous fertilizer made the plants grow so fast, they seemed to be in a race.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as nitrogenous as the air we breathe, full of life and energy.
meanings.sent5: The nitrogenous smell of the fertilizer lingered in the air, reminding us of its power.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or containing nitrogen compounds.
meanings.sent1: The nitrogenous waste from the factory polluted the river.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the nitrogenous compounds found in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The nitrogenous chemicals in the lab were so potent, they seemed to have a life of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as nitrogenous as the chemicals in the test tube, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The nitrogenous nature of the compound made it stand out among the others, like a bright star in the sky.
